text: This is literally disgusting.

name: fathington
text: I picture Onstad on all fours, watching the daschunds eat their burgers and whispering "Arn't you just vile, you little shits."

name: fathington
text: Fuckin'... italics or no, you catch my drift right?

name: glorify
text: I can't stop laughing, good sir.

text: a person cannot possibly mock something they love in good conscience. c'est impossible.

text: Thousands of Cubs fans would disagree.

text: i dont care for the support of a cubs fan.

name: geysershitdick
text: Think that's a Magreaux Dog eating that burger?

name: mastronaut
text: It tried to walk man! It tried to WALK!!

name: fosters
text: I guess it could be your Magreaux Dog if your torso accounts for 90% of your body mass and you have no idea how to properly eat a hamburger.

name: brzbee
text: Oh god, I'm screwed!

name: srikamaraja
text: WHO DARES LAME THE MAGREAUX DOG REFERENCE? DID GOD LAME JESUS AS HE WAITED TO BE BORN?

text:
"She's a Lady Lingerie"
Also big points for "control the flow of her menses"

name: deancain29
text: the dog! hamburger! disgusting! I think I went blind for a bit with laughter!

name: connellingus
text: I thought that this and the first part were kind of weak as far as supplemental material goes, since there will probably never be a reason why the reader will need to know where the Achewood Underground's Chili Pepper Lunch Company is. However, the description of the dogs and how literally disgusting they are completely redeemed it.

name: icecube
text: You are correct sir. This is the only time in history that the word "literally" has been used wrongly rightly.

name: stuart
text:

name: daseinphil
text: Is that the Musee D'Orsay in the background of the middle left photo?

name: _cheesekayke
text: Yep. That is an excellent museum.

name: andrew_
text:
[IMGS OFF]

I had a great time at the Musee D'Orsay.

name: _cheesekayke
text: I remember looking at that! I was standing next to it with this middle-aged Asian couple giggling like crazy. It was in like the first room on the left when you entered the building, which makes me think they REALLY wanted every visitor to see it.

name: professorhazard
text: The Asian couple were giggling because they don't know about Pubics.

name: _cheesekayke
text: And I just noticed your Philippe icon, which makes your post so much better times googleplex.

name: chaobell
text: Chubbied for combination of image and shocked Philippe icon.

name: charchar
text: Your avatar: "Individuals" by Vik Muniz? Done in Bosco syrup? please?

name: relaxing
text: l'origine du monde

name: apricotta
text:
It's very easy to recognize Americans in a French museum: they always stop in front of the nude drawings for, like, eternity.

Also, they speak English.

name: gormster
text: I think Anglophones in French museums are more likely to be Britons than Americans.

name: apricotta
text:
Nope.

First off - their accent would give them away.
Second off - I swear to God 85% of Anglophones in Paris are American tourists (based on my 3-year experience of living in that forsaken city).
Third off - Brits wouldn't spend THIS LONG in front of a nude drawing.

name: pr0ncess
text: I so wish I could get a closer view of that photo of the Citizens of the Achewood underground chasing the remote-control car over the crest of a small hill... I can just see Philippe and I have a feeling it's an adorable scene.

name: ravindra108
text: If you look to the left of Philippe, you can barely make out a stuffed bear... Possibly Teodor, but very difficult to say.

name: joeyramoney
text: thus begins the debate: where is Philippe from?

name: nutmeg
text: this strip suggests France. so does his name.

name: rowboat
text: He is from an otter.

name: i_love_kate
text: HE IS FROM A FIVE YEAR-LONG BACKGROUND.

name: ravindra108
text: He's from five years of... HISTORY!
